text:
Hey folks, has anyone experienced issues with HubSpot forms not appearing on WordPress?
I've copied the embed code across, and there's no console errors appearing (only a missing SVG), but still no joy. Sometimes it will appear and sometimes it will disappear
Any advice on this would be helpful, our client is less than pleased with this atm :grimacing:
Most of the time it's not there on page load, then appears on page refresh
<@U24DCSJBE> would be the person at HS to look at this i believe
<@U2H3TT8F2> Managed to sort it using the `target` method mentioned here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Conversion-Tools/Embedded-Forms-Erratic-Behavior-Not-loading-sometimes/td-p/27756>

Anyone else experiencing glitchy issues with the Source Code editor in the in-page email editor? It insists on skipping an entire section of tags that I'm trying to clean up. <https://share.vidyard.com/watch/7em7DBe1NhXk2vTvWcgWe3>? Also jumps around while scrolling, curser also seems to be jumping around, and the issue doesn't seem to be going away when I back out or refresh the page. Not a day-killer, just super annoying.

:wave: thanks for looping me in AJ, as far as I'm aware that shouldn't really be an issue any more, I believe the team were able to resolve the "rendering in random places" issue but I'll loop them in and see if they can get to the bottom of it. <@U9MAWTESW> any chance you could DM me the page you're working on so I can share with the team?

<@U24DCSJBE> It's actually a site-wide issue with all the HS forms, I'm still in the process of fixing these, but using the `target` method is fixing them atm. The site URL is <https://www.focusclinics.com/> (WordPress site)
Thanks Ryan, long shot but do you have a test page that you haven't yet added the `target` attribute too that we can test with?
If you access the home page of that site, the form with the blue background to it, doesn't yet have the `target` added to it
Gotcha, thanks. I can't seem to reproduce with that form right now but I'll share with the team and see what they think
I'll let you know when I get some news, thanks again for the heads up :+1:
Thanks Shay :star2:
:wave: Would you mind providing a link to that portal :smile:
Anyone a regex wizard? I’m looking for regex to use in a module’s field that just needs to test if the input is a valid CSS class name
would it include the “.”?
found this quickly on SO: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/448981/which-characters-are-valid-in-css-class-names-selectors>
it would not include the “.”
I’ll try that expression
thank you!

Appears to work flawlessly - incase anyone else needs that one.

I was googling like mad to find that, and must not have been searching the right words, was about to manually learn regex just to write my own.

Update on yesterday's .hs-responsive-embed-iframe cc <@U2H3TT8F2> and <@U7SL518D6> this issue should be resolved at this time.  Let me know if you're seeing anything differently and please accept my apologies for the delay.

found this inspecting the page editor:
<https://spin.d.pr/2UzMgM+>
Hell yea this module is CMV2 :fist: lol
heh, MOdule FOrm
AHHH… okay wondered if there was some kinda lingo behind that or someone was just feeling pumped after watching snakes on a plane.
it is a bit of an inside joke though
